description: [Status: stable] [Name: snake-case-type-alias] [Message: Type alias {name} should be CamelCase] What it does Checks for type aliases that do not use the CamelCase naming convention. Why is this bad? It's conventional to use the CamelCase naming convention for type aliases, to distinguish them from other variables. Example from typing import TypeAlias type_alias_name: TypeAlias = int Use instead: from typing import TypeAlias TypeAliasName: TypeAlias = int
